text:
(1)
Richmond Road, east side, between Clove Road and Price Street, showing street car barns and offices (building in center) of the trolley company. The view is northward from Clove Road.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A view of old street cars beside the barns.

July 6, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
Another view of the old trolleys.

P. L. Sperr.
July 6, 1927.

Clove Baptist Cemetery (Staten Island): Some of the tombstones in a state of abandon. The cemetery dates from 1809 and occupies a plot of 150 by 100 feet at the S.W. corner of Clove Road and Richmond Road.

P. L. Sperr

(2)

A view from Clove Road.

P. L. Sperr
title: Cemeteries - Clove Baptist Cemetery - Staten Island.

text:
44 Price Street, south side, between Clove and Richmond Roads, showing St. Simons Protestant Episcopal church. The view is westward.

March 20, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Richmond: Price Street - betw. Clove Road - Richmond Road

Emerson Hill, Staten Island: Viewing south across Clove Road (at Price Street) and showing new fashionable residences rising on the hill.

View 1: April 22, 1932
View 2: June 5, 1931

P. L. Sperr

Emerson Hill, Staten Island: Viewing south across Clove Road (at Price Street) and showing new fashionable residences rising on the hill.

View 1: April 22, 1932
View 2: June 5, 1931

P. L. Sperr

(1)
786 Richmond Road, east side, between Clove Road and Baltic Avenue, showing the house of Judge Emerson, brother of Ralph Waldo Emerson. The view is north.
February 15, 1929

P. L. Sperr

(2)
The same at a later date. The front of the house was sliced off for the widening of Richmond Road.

P. L. Sperr

May 17, 1932

Richmond Road, at Clove Road: though not a native of Staten Island, Al Smith (former Governor Alfred Emanuel Smith), has his admirers there, too.

June 23, 1937.

P.L. Sperr
